properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Neilborough, Raywood.
  • The fire at Raywood-Elmore Rd, Raywood is under control.
  • Firefighters are currently in attendance blacking out.
  • Smoke may still be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  •  This Community Information message replaces the Advice Message issued at 3.42pm on 4/12/2025.
  • Be aware that there will be emergency service vehicles and some large machinery using the roads in the area.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following service can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Services on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

- Be aware that there will be emergency service vehicles and some large machinery using the roads in the area.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Markwood, between Bridle Track Road and Harrington Track
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Markwood, between Bridle Track Road and Harrington Track.
  • There is a bushfire at Markwood that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is in the vicinity of Henley's Ridge Markwood.
  • Go to VicEmergency for other warnings current for this fire.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice Message issued at 12.08 pm.
  • A Community Meeting is scheduled for 4.00pm at the Milawa Football Ground, club rooms at the corner of Snow Rd and Sports Ground Lane, Milawa.   
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • Attend the Community Meeting scheduled for 4.00pm at the Milawa Football Ground, club rooms at the corner of Snow Rd and Sports Ground Lane, Milawa.   
Impacts in your area: 
  • Keep roads clear to allow emergency vehicles access for firefighting 
  • The following roads have reduced speed limit: Snow Road from Carboor-Everton Road, Markwood to Illawong Road, Markwood.
  • The following roads are closed: Bennetts Lane, from Carboor-Everton Road, Markwood to Woods Land, Markwood. Illawong Road, from Snow Road, Markwood to Yarrabee Road, Illawong Road, Markwood.
  • Firefighters and aircraft are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  •  Further road closures are proposed please check the VicTraffic website (Vic Traffic) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.   
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 03.00pm or as the situation changes.
Residents should expect to continue to see a significant number of fire trucks and heavy machinery including excavators in the fire area. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Markwood, between Bennetts Lane and Bridle Track Road
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Markwood, between Bennetts Lane and Bridle Track Road. 
  • There is a bushfire that started at Snow Road, Markwood is not yet under control.  
  • The bushfire is travelling from Snow Road in a south-easterly direction towards Whorouly-Bobinawarrah Rd.  
  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 
  • It is not safe to return to the area. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act message issued at 09.52am Friday. 
The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do:  
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area: 
  • The following roads have reduced speed limit: Snow Road from Carboor-Everton Road, Markwood to Illawong Road, Markwood.
  • The following roads are closed: Bennetts Lane, from Carboor-Everton Road, Markwood to Woods Land, Markwood. Illawong Road, from Snow Road, Markwood to Yarrabee Road, Illawong Road, Markwood.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Firefighters and aircraft are responding to this fire.
  • Keep roads clear for emergency services.
  • Check the Vic Traffic website (Vic Traffic) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.   

The next update is expected by 9.00 pm or as the situation changes.   
Residents should expect to continue to see a significant number of fire trucks and heavy machinery including excavators in the fire area. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

Incident Location: Snow Road, Markwood
Issue Date: Friday 05 December 2025, 02:55 pm
Next Update: Friday 05 December 2025, 09:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38590/moreinfo

This Watch and Act message is being issued for Markwood, between Bennetts Lane and Bridle Track Road. 
- There is a bushfire that      started at Snow Road, Markwood is not yet under control.  
- The bushfire is      travelling from Snow Road in a south-easterly direction towards Whorouly-Bobinawarrah Rd.  
- The spread of the      bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You      must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 
- It is not safe to return to the area. Be aware of      potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
-   This Watch and Act      replaces the Watch and Act message issued at 09.52am Friday.   


The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Patchewollock.
  • There is a bushfire at Bronzewing State Forest, near Moloney Road that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is slowly spreading south in the Bronzewing State Forest.
  • A west to north westerly wind change is expected early afternoon. 
  • There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/12/2025 05:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.sourceTitle: Severe Weather Warning for DAMAGING WINDS
properties.name: Severe Weather Warning for DAMAGING WINDS
properties.webHeadline:
For ALPINE PEAKS (above 1200 metres): Strong winds averaging 50 to 60 km/h with DAMAGING WIND GUSTS of around 90 to 100 km/h are likely to develop from Saturday morning. The risk of DAMAGING WIND GUSTS is expected to ease during Saturday evening.
For remaining areas (below 1200 metres): Strong winds ...

properties.webHeadline: A fire has started There is no immediate danger. Stay up to date in case the situation changes

Today, Fri, 5 Dec 2025 has been declared a day of Total Fire Ban in the Mallee district(s) of Victoria.  No fires can be lit or be allowed to remain alight in the open air from 12:01 AM on Fri, 5 Dec 2025 until 11:59 PM Fri, 5 Dec 2025.

tfb.Mallee: YES - TOTAL FIRE BAN IN FORCE
